properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 21 at 4:51AM PST until January 21 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW TODAY...

.A cold front will bring widespread precipitation to northwest
California today. Snow levels will fall to 4000 feet today. This
will result in mostly rain and wet road conditions across the
passes of Highway 299, and just minor accumulations, if any, along
Highway 36. However, up to a foot of snow will be possible at
Scott Mountain Summit on Highway 3.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 4500 feet. Total snow
accumulations of 3 to 14 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45
mph.

* WHERE...Northern Trinity County including Scott Mountain
Summit on Highway 3.

* WHEN...Until 3 PM PST today.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Chain
requirements over Scott Mountain Summit and periods of road
closure are possible. Blowing and drifting snow could make
visibility poor.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state of California can be
obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 4500 FEET
